result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Payne, Jason T

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jason T Payne in court.  Attorney Christopher Scott Carson in court for Jason T Payne.  Assistant District Attorney Jessica Bellows for ADA Jack T Eichorst in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense Counsel informed the court his client is requesting a jury trial.  State's offer was placed on the record, the defendant rejected the offer.  Court advised parties there will be no further negotiations in this matter.  Case is adjourned in Br 45 for final pretrial and jury trial.  
State and defense were advised that all pretrial documents must be filed 48 hours in advance of final pre trial .  If any motions are to be litigated, the motions  must be filed by 11/11/22 and any reply/responses filed by 11/25/22.  Parties are to contact the court for motion hearing date.    mn
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jason T Payne in court.  Attorney Christopher Scott Carson in court for Jason T Payne.  Attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Court reviewed State's Motion to adjourn. Discussion placed on the record. State provided update to the Court regarding request for adjournment. Court GRANTS State's request to adjourn hearing. Parties selected new date. Court ordered case adjourned for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 45.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Notice of Motion To Adjourn_1 - Payne, Jason T.pdf, Filed.

Defendant Jason T Payne in court.  Attorney Christopher Scott Carson in court for Jason T Payne.  Attorney Jack T Eichorst in court for State of Wisconsin.  Parties before the court for scheduling.  Discovery and Offer has been submitted to Defense.  The Defense is requesting a short adjournment to review the offer and requests a hearing date for Projected plea and sentencing in Br 45.   mn
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jason T Payne in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. 
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no possession or use any dangerous weapons or firearms.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (7/30/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DTH (2/15/2007),DJP (7/3/1989), JRJ (1/9/1997) and VAS (6/25/1956).
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

ADDRESS INFO for Jason T Payne
Current: 8119 W Thurston Ave Lower, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 07-28-2022)
Prior: 3118 North Buffum Street, Milwaukee, WI 53212
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Jason T Payne in court with attorney Christopher Scott Carson.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room G55 in CJF
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
